Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on freedom of speech, a fundamental right.
There is concern that the law could be misused by future governments to suppress dissent and manipulate justice.
The government lacks the objectivity and capability to determine what constitutes misinformation.
The vast amount of information available makes it impractical for any body to discern truth from falsehood comprehensively.
The legislation could cause harm by censoring potentially truthful information, as illustrated by the COVID-19 lab origin debate.
Notable Quotes: This proposed 'misinformation' law is an attack on our basic human rights by a government that is supposed to uphold those rights, not stifle them.
No government body has the wisdom or ability to sort out what is true and what isnâ€™t.
Censoring truthful reporting about the lab leak theory will itself cause 'harm' by preventing us from learning from our mistakes.
